intro: Pedicularis apodochila, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive hooded labellum. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often at high altitudes. Due to its specialized ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
